main event: A civilian observed a round, silver object, the size of a dime at arm's length, which was stationary for 30 seconds, and was concluded to be a balloon.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a dime at arm's length, indicating its small size and distance from the observer.
No sound was heard, and there were no tail trails or exhausts, suggesting unconventional characteristics.
Aircraft circled below the object as if searching for something, adding to the mystery of the sighting.
The observer was a 54-year-old welder from Michigan, providing specific identifying information.
The report mentions that no explanation could be offered at the time and that further investigation was scheduled, indicating the seriousness of the observation.
location: 5 miles north of White Cloud, Mich.
